incident_types.less_lethal: Pepper spray, rubber bullets, tear gas, tasers

collection_methods.foia: Obtained via Freedom of Information Act

multi_person_incidents.description: Schema for incidents affecting multiple people

fields.affected_count: Total number of people directly affected by the incident

affected_breakdown.description: Object with detailed counts by category

multi_person_incidents.note: affected_count represents people with documented negative outcomes (arrested, injured, detained), not total crowd size

primary.name: Deportation Data Project
primary.description: Tracks ICE arrest counts by state

secondary.name: AILA Deaths at Adult Detention Centers
Wikipedia List of deaths in ICE detention
ILRC State Map on Immigration Enforcement

states_searched_no_tier1_data.description: States systematically searched for Tier 1-2 data but found no documented incidents
search_methodology: AILA Deaths at Adult Detention Centers compilation
Wikipedia List of deaths in ICE detention
State-specific news searches for 'ICE detention death [state] 2025 2026'
ACLU litigation databases for each state
states_searched_no_tier1_data.explanation: NO ICE custody deaths (Tier 1) occurred in these 12 states during 2025-2026. This is NOT a data gap - it reflects geographic concentration of ICE detention infrastructure. Deaths in custody are concentrated where major facilities exist.
states_searched_no_tier1_data.note: These states DO have Tier 3-4 incidents documented (mass raids, protests) but these are not used in ratio calculations due to selection bias risk.

confidence_levels.HIGH: Data from official government sources with mandated reporting
confidence_levels.MEDIUM_HIGH: Data from FOIA releases or systematic investigative journalism
confidence_levels.MEDIUM: Data from systematic news search with known coverage biases
confidence_levels.LOW_MEDIUM: Data available but significant gaps acknowledged
confidence_levels.LOW: Ad-hoc data collection with high selection bias risk

known_undercounts.finding: Found 170+ US citizen detentions; only ~30 fully documented in this dataset
Identified 26 shootings; Tier 2 has 12 with full details
Stopped publishing death reports after Oct 2025
Found ICE couldn't provide 5 years of use-of-force data

limitations: Uneven geographic coverage of incident data
Media coverage bias (sanctuary states may receive more coverage)
Small sample sizes in most state/classification categories
